abstract: New Zealand's prime minister says it is "critical" that a foundered ship stay intact so that workers can resume pumping oil from the vessel.
snippet: New Zealand's prime minister says it is "critical" that a foundered ship stay intact so that workers can resume pumping oil from the vessel.
lead_paragraph: Rough weather forces workers to stop pumping oil from a damaged container ship that seems to be on the verge of cracking apart completely and sinking off the coast of New Zealand. The government calls it the largest maritime spill in the country's history. [nzherald.co.nz]

headline.main: On Our Radar: A Listing, Leaking Ship
